Title: Commercial Interior Designer
RoleDescription:
The salary range (or base pay) for this position is $57,600-$70,500 however, base pay offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Restricted stock units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered.
Commercial Interior Designer
Join our dynamic team as a Interior Designer, where you'll detailed design solutions and manage project timelines from concept to installation. Collaborate with consultants, contractors, and clients to deliver exceptional, customized design experiences while ensuring the highest quality and efficiency in every project.
What you'll do:

Utilize AutoCAD and other proprietary software to provide programming, space planning, product specifications and parts lists 
Works with consultants, contractors, fabricators, to meet overall project objectives 
Provide fabric and finish palettes 
Generate all required drawings including 2D, 3D, and installation plans 
Establish project budget and timeline in collaboration with Sales team 
Field verify critical measurements and coordinate data and electrical locations as needed
Participate in final installation walkthrough and punch list coordination as needed
Participate and/or lead customer meetings 
Call suppliers and manufacturers to request samples and other product information as needed 
Assist in managing client expectations 
Contribute to office activities, initiatives, and learning programs 
Utilizes Project Management tools to manage and maintain team workflow (Salesforce, ProjectHub, Google Sheets)
Travel may be required up to 25%

What you'll need:

BS or BA in Interior Design from an accredited institution 
Professional experience preferred, not required  
Proficient in AutoCAD, Adobe Creative Suite - InDesign & Photoshop, and ability to learn other software programs quickly 
Knowledge of the design process, including FF&E, furniture systems, specifications, colors, and materials 
Outstanding conceptual 3D thinking 
Effective verbal and written communication skills 
Ability to focus on a variety of project types by industry vertical in various design stages 
Ability to work well in a team environment 
Strong organization, communication, and relationship management skills

Title: Full-Time Customer Experience Specialist
RoleDescription:
Brief Overview of Position
Perigolds Physical Retail team is reinventing the shopping experience for luxury Home by curating our portfolio of furniture, dcor, housewares, and home improvement categories into one store- come be a part of it! We are seeking a Customer Experience Associate to help launch all customer experience components and functions in the very first physical retail store. 
The Customer Experience Associate position at Perigold delivers outstanding customer service through various communication channels, including in-person, phone, and email. Our Customer Experience Associates will address customer inquiries and concerns promptly and professionally, assisting them with navigating the Perigold website, placing orders, and understanding product details. 
They will collaborate with internal teams to resolve order-related issues, track shipments, and ensure timely deliveries. While also being responsible for staying up-to-date on Perigolds extensive product catalog and effectively communicating product information to customers. 
Associate responsibilities are expected but not limited to handling order processing, transactions, cancellations, returns, maintaining store appearance including maintaining store areas as clean and organized, retrieving shopping carts, fulfilling customer online orders and exchanges in line with company policies. 
A key role of each associate is to relay feedback from the customer, by facilitating meaningful and engaging conversations. By communicating customer feedback, associates will have key information to share with leadership and in turn equip management with the necessary information needed to make continuous improvement initiatives. 
Associates are expected to adhere to Perigolds policies and procedures while utilizing customer service tools to maintain accurate records.
 
Essential Functions
Customer Support: 

Provide excellent customer service through various channels, including phone and email. 
Address customer inquiries, concerns, and issues promptly and professionally. 
Assist customers with order tracking, product information, and general inquiries. 
Assist customers with carry outs, in-store pickup processes, cart retrieval from the parking lot.

Product Knowledge: 

Develop a deep understanding of Perigolds product catalog to effectively assist customers in their product selection. 
Stay updated on new product releases, features, and specifications. 

Problem Resolution: 

Resolve customer complaints and issues by collaborating with other departments, such as logistics or product teams, to ensure timely and satisfactory resolutions. 

Order Management: 

Assist customers with order processing, cancellations, returns, fulfillment processes and exchanges. Collaborate with the logistics team to track shipments and ensure on-time delivery. 

Communication: 

Communicate effectively with customers, providing clear and concise information. Keep customers informed about the status of their orders and any potential delays. 

Customer Feedback: 

Collect customer feedback to identify areas for improvement in products, services, or processes. Share feedback with relevant teams to contribute to continuous improvement. 

Policy Adherence: 

Ensure adherence to Perigolds policies and procedures while assisting customers. Keep up-to-date with any changes in company policies 

Technology Utilization: 

Utilize various customer service tools, software, and systems to efficiently manage customer interactions. 

Cross-Functional Collaboration: 

Collaborate with other departments, such as marketing, sales, logistics, visual merchandising and product teams, to ensure a seamless customer experience.

 
Experience Qualifications

<1 year Experience in a customer service setting, preferably retail. (Preferred)
<1 year  Experience in interacting directly with customers, where issues were resolved, while ensuring a positive experience. (Preferred)
<1 year Experience in identifying and solving customer issues, collaborating with teams to address challenges, and finding solutions to enhance customer satisfaction. (Preferred)
<1 year Effectively managing time, to include handling multiple customer inquiries, prioritizing tasks, and ensuring timely responses. (Preferred)

Title: Training Supervisor
RoleDescription:
The salary range for this position is $70,500 - $78,500 per year. The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. 
We are the front-line leaders in the new Wayfair Global Supply Chain Workforce Support Network. We are positioned forward at all the network locations providing direct training & development support to our Supply Chain teams. We bring network-wide resources along with realistic and challenging training initiatives to optimize performance, employee engagement, and professional development for associates and leaders. We are culture enthusiasts throughout our entire Supply Chain network.  
We are looking for a proven leader to influence cross-functional teams responsible for development, standard work, and championing the Wayfair culture in Cranbury, NJ. The candidate must be a collaborative problem solver, strategic planner, one who can build & manage high performing teams in a fast-paced, rapidly challenging, and fluid environment. 
What You'll Do

Coordinate, lead, and execute all training functions within the Cranbury, NJ fulfillment center including new hire orientation, job function training, and continuous development.
Organize, develop, and lead a team of exceptional and dedicated Training Ambassadors within the Warehouse Associate population; focus on improving safety, quality, and retention.
Lead various training sessions as needed, including but not limited to: New Hire Fundamentals, Powered Industrial Vehicle (PIV) training, Quality & Process (Current & New SOP) Training.
Provide professional development programming for warehouse associates and leaders. 
Record, track, and drive compliance on all training initiatives and report out on training metrics using Learning Management System.
Partner with Global Supply Chain Training & Engagement, Safety, and Operations teams to develop and improve training resources, strategies, and processes.
Support Global Supply Chain Training, Safety, and Operations by championing new training programs, processes, and initiatives; provide upward feedback and share observations with business owners to improve alignment, compliance, quality, and engagement.
Manage priorities, set goals, and partner strategically with stakeholders to align network training initiatives with the local sites operational and training needs.
Flex to perform work and lead by example on the warehouse floor alongside department leaders and associates during high volume seasons or as needed

What Youll Need

3+ years of experience in Training, Learning & Development and/or Organizational Leadership OR 4 year degree in relevant field, required
Experience in Operations or Supply Chain preferred
Raymond and/or Crown forklift/powered industrial vehicle certifications preferred.  Willingness to be trained on multiple vehicle types required.
Leadership skills and the ability to make decisions with little or no guidance based on policies or best practices.
Exceptional written and verbal communication to effectively communicate with all stakeholder levels.
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
A seek-to-understand mindset and teamwork strategies that will allow you to connect with and influence diverse groups of people, including your training audience and stakeholder network.

Title: Senior Business Analyst, Transportation & Delivery Enablement
RoleDescription:
At this time, Wayfair does not provide visa sponsorship for employment authorization for this position.
 
Must be on-site in Boston, MA (Monday-Thursday)
The salary range for this position is $104,500 - 118,250. The base pay offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.
 
Senior Business Analyst, Transportation & Delivery Process
We're looking for a Senior Business Analyst to join our Transportation & Delivery Process and Technology Enablement team. In this role, you'll be a key player in implementing new technology and processes for our last-mile delivery network. Your responsibilities will include gathering requirements from business stakeholders, validating them with our engineering team, and supporting the successful rollout of new solutions. You'll also be responsible for providing valuable insights into project performance.
Who We Are
The Global T&D Process & Technology Enablement team is the driving force behind significant change at Wayfair. We are the "go-to" team for any disruptive technology or process in the first, middle, or last mile of our supply chain. We ensure successful implementations by bringing the right people together, considering all implications during the design and build phases, and tracking the success of our rollouts. Our team is based in Boston but travels frequently to our Home Delivery Operations facilities to oversee new launches.
What You'll Do 
We are looking for an analytical, action-oriented, and collaborative individual who can translate business problems to tech improvements, actionable insights and data driven solutions  within the last mile delivery space, to influence operational results and tech systems. Successful individuals in this role excel at both qualitative and quantitative analysis while also being eager to communicate upward and outward to tell a concise story through data.

Become a SME in Wayfairs last mile tech and processes in order to answer questions from business stakeholders & execution and attend process and tech escalations
Become a liaison between engineering and business stakeholders to funnel the right requirements and convert them into product or process enhancements
Communicate regularly with cross functional partners to understand process gaps, business trends and new ways to break down problems into solutions
Engage in roadmapping and prioritization through diligent opportunity sizing and scoping efforts
Build dashboards, visualizations and prototypes to translate data sets into insights and actions
Conduct ad hoc analyses and build advanced reports 
Support tech and process rollout from requirements gathering to launch
Manage processes and multiple engagements with key cross-functional partners

What You'll Need 

Bachelors degree in a quantitative field
2+ years of professional experience
Team-first attitude with enthusiasm for cross-functional collaboration
High attention to detail and proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously
An entrepreneurial spirit and mindset; you must be adaptable and comfortable with change. 
Potential travel to Wayfair sites up to once/month
Advanced experience with Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets, SQL or GBQ, and data visualization tools such as Google Data Studio (Looker, Tableau, or PowerBI)

An Important Note about Wayfair's In-Office Policy:
All Boston-based interns, Co-ops, and corporate employees will be in office in a hybrid capacity. Employees will work in the office on designated days, Monday - Thursday, and work remotely Friday.

Title: Senior Assistant Store Manager, Sales & Retail Engagement
RoleDescription:
Senior Assistant Store Manager, Sales & Retail Engagement
Location: 3232 Lake Ave. Wilmette, IL
The salary range (or base pay) for this position is $117,000 - $130,000, however, base pay offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. A performance bonus may be a part of the compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered.
Overview: 
At Wayfair, we deliver a best-in-class customer experience in furniture and home by empowering talented, driven individuals like you. As a Senior Assistant Store Manager of Sales, youll lead the sales floor team/ This includes sales, design, and customer experience to create seamless, welcoming shopping journeys. Youll be a key partner to the General Manager, driving sales, optimizing operations, and fostering collaboration across specialty categories like appliances, home improvement, and mattresses. If youre passionate about coaching teams, solving challenges in a fast-paced environment, and delivering authentic, customer-focused service, your professional home awaits you here at Wayfair.
What Does a Sr. Assistant Store Manager Do?

 Lead Sales & Design Teams: Directly manage and develop the sales floor team, including managers, sales associates, designers, and customer experience specialists, ensuring customers receive top-notch support and service.
 Be a Senior Operational Partner: Serve as a key-holder and senior support across Assistant Store Manager duties, especially in specialty areas like appliances, home improvement, and mattresses, to keep store operations running smoothly.
 Unite Store Teams: Collaborate across Salesfloor, Logistics, Visual, Asset Protection, Talent, and more to align goals and execute store-wide initiatives that elevate customer experience and business success.
 Champion Customer Experience: Deliver authentic, friendly service while coaching your team to build complex, connected solutions that balance speed with personalized attention.
 Drive Sales & Results: Partner with the General Manager to optimize our store processes, manage profitability, control labor expenses, and translate data into actionable coaching and team improvements.
 Foster Collaboration & Culture: Create a positive, team-first environment by encouraging cross-functional collaboration and continuous growth among Associates, Specialists, and Designers.
 Own Floor Operations: Maintain strong leadership presence as Manager on Duty handling scheduling, opening and closing procedures, and ensuring the right team is in the right place at the right time.
 Innovate & Improve: Contribute ideas for new tools, processes, and technologies that help your teams work smarter and more efficiently.
 Manage Multiple Priorities: Stay organized and communicate clearly while juggling fast-paced demands and following through on action plans.
 Partner with Home Office: Work closely with corporate teams to share insights and support store performance enhancements.

Youll Thrive in this Role if You Have:

 Proven Leadership: 5+ years managing large teams in fast-paced, high-volume retail or specialty selling environments, where you led with confidence and clear direction.
 Customer-Obsessed: Strong background in selling and delivering exceptional, authentic customer servicealways focused on creating memorable experiences.
 Operational Excellence: Experience driving processes and operations as designed, with a knack for optimizing workflows and boosting team performance.
 Analytical Mindset: Comfortable diving into data, interpreting KPIs, and making smart, data-driven decisions to continuously improve results.
 People Developer: Skilled at coaching, mentoring, and motivating others, fostering growth and accountability with empathy and professionalism.
 Cross-Team Collaborator: Able to bring together multiple teams and functions, aligning diverse stakeholders behind a common goal.
 Tech Confident: Comfortable using Google Suite, inventory management systems, and ready to quickly learn new tools that empower your team.
 Flexible & Dependable: Willing to work varied retail hours including early mornings, evenings, weekends, and holidays to meet business and customer needs.
 Hands-On Attitude: Ready to jump in on the floor or in the warehousewhether its stocking shelves, managing inventory, or helping with physical tasks.

Additional Physical and Environmental Requirements:

 Physical Activity: Frequent standing, walking, and reaching with hands and arms; occasional sitting, climbing, balancing, and crawling.
 Mobility & Movement: Frequent stooping, kneeling, and crouching throughout the day.
 Lifting Ability: Must be able to lift and/or move up to 50 lbs regularly.
 Vision Requirements: Includes close, distance, color, and peripheral vision; depth perception and the ability to adjust focus.
 Temperature Flexibility: Comfortable in environments with varying temperature conditions.
 Noise Tolerance: Occasional exposure to moderate noise levels and physical activity.
 Safety Awareness: Minimal exposure to workplace or environmental hazardsmust adhere to all safety protocols.

What are the Benefits*?

 Competitive Pay: Earn competitive compensation, with regular opportunities for performance-based increases and performance based bonuses.
 Career Growth: Access professional development and advancement opportunities to help you grow with us.
 Health Benefits from Day One: Medical, dental, and vision insurance coverage starts on your first day.
 Time to Recharge: Take the time you need with our generous PTO policy for L4+ leaders which is designed to support work-life balance while aligning with our business needs and team priorities.

RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
Who We Are:
Wayfairs communications platform processes 100+ million daily messages to customers and suppliers around the world through emails, push notifications, and SMS. We're looking for a product manager to orchestrate our next-generation platform to drive scale and resiliency when determining what message goes to which customer through which channel. 
This product manager will work closely with engineers, machine learning scientists, data science analysts, and marketing partners to crystalize the vision for the team and own roadmap prioritization and execution. 
A successful candidate will use technical skills, analytical expertise, and problem solving abilities to help optimize our communication channel performance. They will be an expert on our communications data and infrastructure. This role requires fluency in the underlying technologies to credibly engage engineers and machine learning scientists in conversations around testing, architecture, and delivery. 
We are looking for a product athlete; fluent in Agile and leading frameworks, with a history of successfully designing and launching marketing automation, B2C and/or B2B products. 
This role is located in Bengalaru, India and will engage regularly with team members and marketing stakeholders in Boston, Massachusetts. 
What You'll Do

Partner with product and engineering leadership to define and deliver on the long-term strategy for the send intelligence and send governance capabilities across the Wayfair Communications platform.
Collaborate closely with engineers, machine learning scientists, data science analysts and marketing stakeholders to align on top priorities and roadmap for the Intelligence team that supports Wayfair's Communications platform. Where there are tradeoffs in prioritization, size effort and upside potential to inform next steps. 
Become a subject matter expert in Wayfairs Communications Platform, which is a proprietary and complex space. This expertise will be pivotal to maximize ROI of integrations, identify opportunities for quick and long term wins, proactively call out risks/blockers, inform phasing and sequencing of initiatives, and more. 
Create high-quality product documentation such as product requirements, test cases, internal specs, and user-facing guides to support successful development and adoption.
Deliver engaging product demos and walkthroughs to cross-functional teams and end users to drive understanding and alignment.
Partner with marketing stakeholders to understand their businesses and co-develop solutions to supercharge growth, improve customer satisfaction and engagement, and increase automation. 
Work with external vendors to fully leverage their capabilities, identify breakthrough opportunities, and resolve operational issues.
Use Agile processes to collaborate with Engineering and Data Science to execute on the roadmap while harnessing the power of emerging technologies. 
Communicate and evangelize the product vision and progress with tech and marketing stakeholders.
Develop and monitor OKRs for key product initiatives and ensure alignment with stakeholder objectives.
Work with leadership to improve product craft and processes throughout the extended Ad Technology and Customer Intelligence team.   

We Are a Match Because You Have:

10+ years of experience with 6+ years of Product Management experience across product discovery, development, and delivery
2+ years building high-volume message products or infrastructure, with experience working for email marketing vendors, email service providers, or cloud service providers a plus. 
Solid understanding of the mechanics and lifecycle of marketing automation, ideally with email, SMS, and push notifications.
Builder mentality -- you think in terms of customer problems and technology solutions, and have demonstrated success in creating business-focused products. 
E-commerce experience preferred but not required. 
Sufficient technical literacy to both understand the underpinnings of products to make key decisions as well as effectively communicate with engineers and data scientists. 
Solid SQL data wrangling skills, ability to create data stories and reports with visualization tools such as Looker, and experience calling APIs using Python or other languages.  
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills at the senior leadership level.
Understanding of email end-to-end delivery including IP addresses, authentication, etc. a plus
A "no excuses" mentality that pushes through issues with creative solutions and tenacity, while maintaining a grace-under-pressure demeanor.
Positive, people-oriented, and energetic attitude.

Senior Business Analyst, Sales Analytics
Wayfair is seeking a relentlessly curious, solutions-oriented Senior Business Analyst to join the Sales Analytics & Data Enablement team within the Global Sales organization. The team exists to marry customer data across sources (internal and external) to deepen our business understanding of our customer base and use those insights to improve the shopping experience across Sales, Site, and Marketing channels. We provide thought leadership and analytical rigor needed to drive our rapidly evolving Wayfair Professional & Global sales teams.
The Sales Analytics & Data Enablement team is responsible for building, managing, and optimizing core reporting artifacts while improving the Sales and customer experience with targeted analyses supporting our Global Sales / B2B long term vision. Our team acts as the Business owners / liaisons to the Global Sales Data Engineering team, ensuring that Business needs are aligned. We are highly cross-functional and work closely with roles in the Technology group (eg: Product Management and Engineering) and are deeply embedded within the business (eg: Field operations, Marketing, and Storefront) with the ultimate goal of growing the Wayfair Professional & Global sales teams. 
In this role, you will be a key business contributor and assist with business insights for leaders driving the Wayfair Professional & Global sales team agendas. This role requires a blend of strong analytical experience, and the ability to communicate analytical insights in a crisp and clear way to the business. Stakeholder management and business acumen will be key components for success. You will apply your analytical knowledge to understand customer behavior and business performance and provide insights to the business designed to enable revenue growth, better customer experience, operational efficiency and profitability. You will think critically to tackle complex challenges in a fast-paced and high-growth environment. You will build a foundation as a trusted partner for the business, contributing insights that directly influence leadership decisions and strategic priorities
What Youll Do

Collaborate with senior leaders to identify key opportunities and challenges, providing data-driven insights that influence business strategies.
Develop a deep understanding of Wayfair Professional and B2C sales operations, including key performance indicators (KPIs) like efficiency and conversion rates, to provide meaningful recommendations.
Use tools like GBQ, SQL, and Looker to analyze customer and business data, synthesize insights, and present clear, actionable recommendations. Conduct analysis with clean data such as sales agent performance or dashboards and provide actionable takeaways and point of view when presenting business cases to senior leadership.
Propose innovative approaches to complex, non-routine problems by connecting analytical insights with business needs.
Work closely with teams across Technology (e.g., Product Management, Engineering) and the Business (e.g., Marketing, Field Operations) to ensure your insights drive action and results.
Oversee and refine analytical work by junior team members, providing guidance to ensure high-quality deliverables while fostering their growth.
Dive into the logic behind data models and operational processes to understand customer behavior, optimize lead generation, and identify opportunities for improved decision-making.
Solve difficult, non-routine analysis problems with deep customer and business focus, leveraging your analytical acumen to recommend innovative business approaches as needed.

What Youll Need

Bachelors degree in a quantitative field
Post-graduate work in related field, prior management consulting experience or internship, a plus
Strong analytical background and 2+ years of experience in extracting insights and operating with large data sets to identify trends and actionable takeaways
Advanced experience with Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets, SQL or GBQ, and data visualization tools such as Google Data Studio (Looker, Tableau, or PowerBI)
Excellent communication, both written and verbally
Data and process-oriented, demonstrated ability to continuously learn new tools
High attention to detail and proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously
Ability to navigate an environment of continuous improvement working through ambiguity in an evolving organization
Ability to collaborate with partners in the Technology organization and the Business organizations to deliver real-time performance data to the business leadership team
A proactive approach to take initiative to dive deeper into the logic behind datasets and data models that are influencing customer targeting, call routing, customer valuation, and similar areas when necessary

Title: Asset Protection Manager
RoleDescription:
Asset Protection Manager
Location: Location: 1801 Howell Mill Road, Atlanta, GA 30318
The salary range for this position is $85,025-$95,712 however, base pay offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. 

 
Overview:
At Wayfair, protecting our people, property, and reputation is at the heart of delivering amazing customer experiences. As our Asset Protection Manager, youll lead the charge in building and sustaining a culture of safety, trust, and accountability across the store. Reporting to the Regional Asset Protection Manager, youll oversee a talented team of ASMs, Specialists, and Guest Experience Hosts to ensure a secure, welcoming, and compliant environment that allows every customer and associate to thrive.
This is more than risk management, its about inspiring confidence, fostering collaboration, and ensuring that safety is woven into every part of the retail experience. Youll partner across functions like Sales, Logistics, Visual, and Talent to minimize shrink, respond to incidents, and champion proactive programs that keep our business resilient. If youre a hands-on, people-first leader with expertise in retail safety and security, with a passion for coaching teams, this is your opportunity to make a lasting impact.
 
What Does an Asset Protection Manager Do?

 Own the AP Strategy: Lead all asset protection and safety initiatives in your store, aligning with regional goals to minimize risk and maximize trust.
 Lead & Develop Your Team: Youll oversee, manage, and inspire a talented and diverse team of asset protection personnel, creating clear pathways for growth and accountability.
 Drive Shrink Reduction: Monitor data, investigate losses, and implement action plans that reduce shrink and improve operational integrity.
 Oversee Incident Response: Lead investigations and response efforts for theft, fraud, safety issues, or emergencies while ensuring thorough documentation and discretion.
 Train & Coach Teams: Deliver impactful training on safety, situational awareness, and emergency procedures. Ensure every team member understands their role in a secure environment.
 Build Cross-Functional Partnerships: Collaborate with Sales, Visual, Logistics, Facilities, Corporate, and other cross-functional teams to integrate AP practices into daily operations.
 Use Data to Inform Action: Leverage reporting tools, audits, and technology like CCTV to identify trends and develop proactive solutions.
 Champion a Culture of Safety: Model professionalism, reinforce compliance, and celebrate wins to keep AP top-of-mind without compromising customer experience.
 Communicate with Impact: Share updates with leadership and the regional AP team on performance trends, risks, and recommendations.
 Stay Hands-On: Be visible, engaged, and approachable on the floor, ready to act quickly and decisively when issues arise.

Youll Thrive in this Role if You Have:

 Retail Experience: 5+ years of asset protection experience in a retail environment, and 2+ at a supervisory level.
 Proven Leadership: 46 years of retail asset protection, security, or loss prevention experience, with at least 2+ years leading teams.
 AP & Safety Expertise: Strong knowledge of brick and mortar asset protection strategies, investigations, and compliance best practices (retail environment preferred).
 Problem-Solving Grit: Ability to balance short-term incident response with long-term prevention strategies in a fast-moving retail setting.
 Analytical Mindset: Skilled in leveraging data and reporting systems to spot risks, measure performance, and recommend improvements.
 Clear Communicator: Able to coach, train, and influence across all levels with professionalism and impact.
 Collaborative Spirit: Energized by working cross-functionally and synthesizing diverse perspectives into cohesive safety solutions.
 High Integrity: Trusted reputation for confidentiality, sound judgment, and professionalism.
 Schedule Flexibility: Willingness to work a retail schedule including evenings, weekends, holidays, and peak periods.
 Degree & Certifications: Wicklander-Zulawski certification is required within 90 days of hire. Bachelors degree, LPC, CFI, or other relevant certifications such as First Aid, CPR, AED, OSHA, PIV are preferred, but not required.

As a Junior Merchandiser, you will develop, execute and drive assortment strategies for your product class. Your ranges will become our Wayfair Verified items (Wayfairs super set of products that capture our highest % of revenue). You will influence how curated product ranges come to life across all Wayfair marketing channels (print, digital and social), ensuring accurate product representation and appropriate shelf placement. You will support strong cross functional relationships to ensure all strategies and goals are achieved, acting as the representative of the customer in strategic decisions on product placement. You will collaborate with Brand Management, Category Management, Marketing, Analytics & Operations, and external Suppliers to ensure the strategic vision is executed all the way to the customer. Leveraging data-driven qualitative and quantitative insights, you'll make a direct impact on overall sales, Wayfair share gains, and empower customers to create a home just right for them. 
 
What you'll do on any given day as a Curated Merchant...
As a Junior Merchandiser, you will be executing against our ambitious goals to shape our future curation strategy.  You will gain a deep understanding of the competitive market for your class. Leveraging this insight to build, curate, and maintain a category assortment strategy for our Wayfair Verified items, developing a shelf space plan and actively managing and iterating our product offering. You will ultimately decide which products will be highlighted and amplified across all marketing channels, with a crisp business justification to support your selection and robust alignment with key stakeholders. You will collaborate with cross-functional partners in Category Management, Promotion Operations, Marketing, Brand, Creative, Merchandising Operations, Analytics and external Suppliers in order to shape and solidify the direction of your class. Ensure your class range is competitive in both product and price.  You will know our customers needs better than anyone else and are constantly thinking about what tomorrows best sellers will be to continue to surprise and delight our target market.
Your success requires tenacity, agility, speed, an analytical mindset, collaboration, influence, and a competitive spirit. You'll use your executive presence to work with and influence stakeholders at all levels and navigate interesting, complex assortment challenges. You will own the performance results though regularly monitoring assortment health though various KPIs and OKRs.
 
What Youll Do 

Build and maintain class assortment strategies, inclusive of developing a shelf space plan and actively selecting, developing and iterating on the product offering
Identify opportunities for category growth, utilizing competitive analysis, trend research, and internal performance monitoring as data points
Partner closely with Category Management, Suppliers, Creative, Marketing, Analytics and Brand to determine how best to bring the selection to life in both digital and print
Maintain a close pulse on trends and customer needs to identify new assortment opportunities.  Partner with category management and external suppliers when curating the line plan to find products that deliver compelling newness and tomorrows best sellers.
Own the financial outcomes for the performance of the products you placed on the premium shelf spaces. Regularly assess performance and revise assortment and shelf space allocation strategy as needed.  
Domestic Travel [4x / month] to our QC & Video Studio operation to ensure product experience
International Travel [1-2x / year] Attend industry trade shows relevant to your categories to partner with strategic suppliers and further optimize our catalog    

 
Who You Are

A bachelor's/masters degree or qualified by experience
Experience buying or merchandising trend-driven categories, curating assortments from a wide range of vendors and classifications, and developing compelling assortment presentations are all highly preferred.
Strong ability to analyze data and think critically, understand and interpret performance trends, and apply learnings to the business  
Strong creative sense, elevated taste level, and love of product.  A genuine passion for industry trends, product design, and home decorating is a plus.
Excellent communication/persuasion skills and ability to influence internal and external stakeholders to align behind and execute against a common goal
Capable of thriving in a high-growth environment in which defining clarity amidst ambiguity and operating in scrappy start-up building mode are everyday activities.  
Self-starter motivated by the potential to define a creative and strategic vision and have an outsized impact within a team and company
Ability to work from Wayfairs London office 3 days per week, Wayfairs Verified Studio 1 day per week in Birmingham &  1 day a week per week remote. Travel for competitor diligence & trade shows.

Title: Senior Software Engineering Manager, Catalog Consumption
RoleDescription:
Software Engineering Manager - Catalog Consumption 
About the job
Candidates for this position are based in Boston, MA, USA and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
 The base pay for this position is $172,500 - $207,000 annually. The base pay offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.
Who We Are:
At Wayfair, we harness the power of data and technology to deliver rich, flexible, and scalable catalog experiences to millions of customers worldwide. The Catalog Data Foundation (CDF) is at the heart of this missionresponsible for ensuring that product data is structured, validated, localized, governed, and projected seamlessly into customer-facing systems. 
 
Within CDF, the Catalog Consumption team enables scalable, reliable access to core catalog data, drives the modernization of key systems and empowers teams to independently manage their data migration and discovery processes. We also build the interfaces between our customer-facing platforms and foundational data systems, while driving strategies that separate customer facing functions (like storefronts and advertising) from fulfillment operations (such as inventory and billing), aiming to enable flexible, large-scale merchandising. 
 
We are highly collaborative, innovative, and data-driven, utilizing cutting-edge technologies like AI, Apollo GraphQL, Aerospike and Kafka in order to build resilient, high-performance systems that serve both our internal teams and our customers. This is a high visibility role that is at the nexus of everything that CDF is doing to power Wayfair's next generation of retail, from customer experiences to our core business operations.
 
We are looking for outstanding candidates to join us as a full-time Engineering Manager. Successful candidates will lead strong, empowered teams that own and operate core subgraphs in the federated ecosystem. You will solve complex technical and business challenges with scalable, performant, and maintainable solutions, while driving best practices in engineering and leadership. Youll be responsible for enabling seamless catalog data access, ensuring subgraph ownership aligns with domain expertise, and delivering the single source of truth that powers Wayfairs merchandising and storefront experiences.
 
You will lead a team based in North America, partnering with Product, Architecture, and other Catalog Foundation teams to design, build, and evolve the next generation of catalog consumption infrastructure. Your team will have end-to-end ownershipfrom idea generation and technical design, through development and deliverygiving you both the responsibility and authority to ensure success.
 
The position offers exceptional opportunities for technical and leadership growth. If you are selected, you will have the chance to directly influence Wayfairs core shopping experience, enabling merchandising flexibility at scale, accelerating innovation, and empowering atomic teams across the company to truly work atomically.
 
Interested in learning more about Wayfairs Engineering community? 

Check out our Wayfair Tech Blog: https://www.aboutwayfair.com/careers/techblog 
Sanjeev Gupta leads the Catalog Foundations and Merch superpod. 
Amr Sinan is the Associate Director for Catalog Platform.

 
What Youll Do:

Lead and manage a team of 6-10 engineers delivering high-throughput, low-latency services.
Own the output of the team from both a technical and performance perspective.
Mentor engineers through training, coaching, code reviews, and 1:1 mentorship, providing career and professional development.
Accountable for the systems built by your team including technical design, development, test, monitoring, and deployment.
Engage your team to construct the technical roadmap and lead planning, delivery and continuous improvement.
Partner with product on defining roadmaps and ensure the team has a compelling mission with well defined KPIs to measure progress and success.
Raise the bar from both a technical and process perspective.
Drive migration of clients off of legacy GraphQL to Federated GraphQL, including documentation, tooling, and direct client support.
Lead the development of interfaces between Storefront and Catalog Foundations, ensuring performant and standardized identifier handling for complex product scenarios.
Design and deliver loosely coupled systems that decouple Customer-facing (Storefront, Ads) concerns from Fulfillment (inventory, billing, shipping).
Champion GraphQL Federation adoption and optimization, ensuring a scalable, performant model for catalog data consumption.

 
What Youll Need:

10+ years of experience in software engineering, with expertise in designing and building scalable platforms.
5+ years managing high caliber Software Engineers delivering complex, world-class, scalable systems.
Experience with Cloud Native architecture platforms (Google Cloud, AWS, Azure).
Experience in backend software engineering using object oriented languages like Java, C#, etc 
Experience working with relational and non-relational databases
Experience working with event-driven architectures, DDD, and TDD
Strong track record partnering with product/program management and cross-functional teams
Experience partnering with cross-functional engineering and science teams
Knowledge of engineering practices and patterns for the full software/hardware/networks development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, certification, and live site operations
Experience in leading the definition and development of multi tier web services
Experience designing or architecting (design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and existing systems
Hands-on experience with GraphQL Federation and large-scale API/schema design
Proven ability to lead data migration and schema evolution efforts, including client enablement and adoption
Experience in recruiting, hiring, mentoring/coaching and managing teams of Software Engineers to improve their skills, and make them more effective product software engineers
Experience analyzing business and operational metrics.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Computer Science degree or postgraduate study. In lieu of a degree, relevant skills and equivalent experience.

Full health benefits available (Medical, Dental, Vision, HSA/FSA) on day one for eligible employees.
No-cost access to 2nd.MD, a virtual expert medical consultation and navigation service.
Global Traveler Health Insurance through GeoBlue.
24/7 access to mental, financial, physical and emotional wellbeing support, plus an enhanced offering of therapy and coaching.
Automatic enrollment into Basic Life and Accidental Death & Disability Insurance.
401(k) matching with immediate vesting.
Paid Parental Leave, Surrogacy & Adoption Reimbursement and Caregiver Services.
Tuition Reimbursement.
Wayfair Employee Discount.
Gym/Fitness Discounts (including Peloton, Wellhub and varying regional memberships).
Exclusive access to thousands of perks & discounts through BenefitHub.
Yearly match up to $500 for personal donations made by employees to registered 501(c)(3) nonprofits.

Title: Part Time Associate, Sales
RoleDescription:
Retail Sales & Engagement Associate (Part-Time)
Location: 3232 Lake Ave. STE 1, Wilmette, IL 3232
The pay for this position is $18 per hour.
 
Overview:
As a Retail Sales Associate, you'll play a vital role in creating an inviting and inspiring experience for every Wayfair customer. Youll actively support customers throughout their shopping journey, from answering questions and placing orders to handling returns and solving issues with empathy and precision. Youll thrive in a proactive sales environment, building personalized connections, boosting store performance, and turning first-time shoppers into loyal customers. If you're passionate about delivering top-tier service and love fast-paced, collaborative work, this role offers a great opportunity to grow with a brand redefining the future of home retail.
What Does a Retail Sales Associate Do?

 Engage and Connect with Customers: Build meaningful relationships by asking thoughtful questions to understand each customer's needs and style preferences.
 Demonstrate Reliability: Show up ready to work, on time, every shift. Communicate proactively about any unexpected absences or challenges.
 Always Be Selling (ABS): Approach every customer as a new sales opportunity. Educate them on purchase options through POS systems, the Wayfair app, quotes, or online tools.
 Provide Product Expertise: Share tailored recommendations using your knowledge of Wayfairs in-store and endless aisle offerings.
 Support Operational Excellence: Help with carry-outs, curbside pickups, cancellations, cart retrieval, and product returns while keeping the store clean and organized.
 Adapt to a Fast-Paced Environment: Stay agile and energized amid frequent product, promotion, and operational changes.
 Collaborate Effectively: Contribute to store success through replenishment, backfills, floor sets, and sharing fresh ideas.
 Deliver Exceptional Service: Provide personalized support and proactive solutions that make Wayfair a go-to shopping destination.

Youll Thrive in This Role if You Have:

 Selling & Service Experience: 1+ year of experience in retail sales or customer-facing roles. Experience in interior design or specialty sales is a plus.
 Open Availability: Willingness to work nights, weekends, and holidays based on business needs.
 Technical Proficiency: Comfortable using mobile devices, store apps, inventory tools, and POS systems.
 Core Competencies: Strong sales instincts combined with great communication, organization, and relationship-building skills.
 Time Management & Multitasking: Ability to juggle multiple customers or tasks at once while staying focused and accurate.

 
Additional Physical and Environmental Requirements:

 Physical Activity: Frequent standing, walking, and reaching with hands and arms; occasional sitting, climbing, balancing, and crawling.
 Mobility & Movement: Frequent stooping, kneeling, and crouching throughout the day.
 Lifting Ability: Must be able to lift and/or move up to 50 lbs regularly.

 Temperature Flexibility: Comfortable in environments with varying temperature conditions.
 Noise Tolerance: Occasional exposure to moderate noise levels and physical activity.
 Safety Awareness: Minimal exposure to workplace or environmental hazardsmust adhere to all safety protocols.

What are the Benefits*?

Title: iOS Mobile Software Engineer
RoleDescription:
Software Engineer - Mobile (m/f/x) - Payments Engineering

The base pay for this position is $159,500 - $192,500 annually. The base pay offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Boston, USA and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
Wayfair is moving the world so that anyone can live in a home they love  a journey enabled by more than 4000 Wayfair engineers. Payments Engineering team owns global payments processing across all of Wayfairs markets and brands, processing more than $12B revenue in 2023. 
The teams mission is to provide a reliable, secure & scalable platform that enables Wayfair to provide the widest range of payment options to our customers through a world-class frictionless experience.
We are building an autonomous cross-functional team of polyglot software engineers, security engineers, data engineers, data analysts, and product managers. Our goal is to move fast, deliver value iteratively while ensuring the stability & correctness of our mission-critical payments systems.
Working within payments you will have the unique opportunity to act within the global wayfair tech organization while working on a well defined problem statement.
We are building truly global distributed systems with very challenging consistency requirements implemented as a set of well-bounded applications. Intrigued? Read on and apply.

As a member of one of the Payments team, you will be working in a highly collaborative environment interacting closely with other software engineers & product managers to identify opportunities and implement solutions.
You will develop new applications but also relentlessly refactor existing ones to make them more robust, maintainable, and scalable. You will do so in an iterative approach using feature toggles and other techniques to ensure agile delivery.
You will contribute and own technical decisions through discussions & writing technical documents such as RFCs & ADRs.
You will contribute to the entire mobile application lifecycle (concept, design, test, release, support & monitor) with support from other mobile teams in the company.
Own our JVM based Backend for Frontend in collaboration with the rest of the team.

What You'll Need:

3+ years experience in building native Android and iOS applications.
In-depth knowledge of at least one programming language like Swift and Kotlin. 
A cross functional mentality including the interest in cross platform contributions (Mobile, Web, Backend).
A passion for writing clean, readable, and thoroughly tested code, and an eagerness to share your expertise with others.
Familiarity with OOP design principles.
Experience having architected or designed complex features with product managers or other stakeholders.
A deep understanding of architecture patterns such as MVP, MVVM, Clean/VIPER, etc., as well as async patterns.
Experience with declarative UX frameworks (Compose, SwiftUI).
Great communication skills and the ability to support technical decision making with the team.

Nice to have experience with

e-commerce or payments
Building mobile SDKs
Swift Package Manager on iOS
Building and consuming BFFs (Backend for Frontend)
Reactive programming (Reactive Streams, Apple Combine, RxJava, Kotlin Coroutines).

Title: Software Engineer II, Storefront
RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
Who We Are:
Wayfair runs the largest custom e-commerce large parcel network in the United States, approximately 1.6 million square meters of logistics space. The nature of the network is inherently a highly variable ecosystem that requires flexible, reliable, and resilient systems to operate efficiently.
We are looking for a passionate Backend Software Engineer to join the Fulfillment Optimization team. This team builds the platforms that determine how customer orders are fulfilled, optimizing for Wayfair profitability and customer delight. A big part of our work revolves around enhancing and scaling customer-facing platforms that provide fulfillment information on our websites, starting at the top of the customer funnel on the search pages all the way through orders being delivered. Throughout this customer journey, we are responsible for maintaining an accurate representation of our dynamic supply chain, determining how different products will fit into boxes, predicting how these boxes will flow through warehouses and trucks, and ultimately surfacing the information our customers need to inform their decision and the details our suppliers and carriers require to successfully execute on the promises made to our customers. We do all of this in milliseconds, thousands of times per second.
What You Will Do:
Flex your strength and knowledge on Java, DevOps, and microservice development.
Define and ensure services are built to industry best practices, including observability, architectural patterns, and inter-team dependency mechanisms (like SLOs)
Work closely with architects and other teams across Storefront to breakdown an existing PHP monolith into well defined Java Microservices with clean boundaries and clear API contracts
Serve as the local technical lead in the critical domain, designing & building a platform that interfaces with many different systems within and outside Wayfair and partner globally.
Architect and write code to implement high-quality, scalable, future-proof services that will have effective system boundaries and will support long-term vision & strategy
Conduct technical debate across an entire platform and help come to durable documented conclusions
Drive high-impact architectural solutions and hands-on development, including inception, design, execution, and delivery following good design and coding practices
Obsessively focus on production readiness for the team including testing, monitoring, deployment, documentation, and proactive troubleshooting
Identify risks and gaps in technical approaches and propose solutions to meet the department's technical vision
Work closely with product managers, designers, and peer engineering teams to define project requirements and execution plans
We Are a Match Because You Have:
3+ years of experience in engineering, with a preference for candidates with a mix of start-up and large-company experience
eComm domain expertise is a bonus
Hands-on experience driving software transformations within high-growth environments at scale
Experienced in architecting and building large-scale, cloud-based, and event-driven systems across various projects
Excellent communication skills with demonstrated experience driving teams forward and ability to influence results
GCP target cloud platform, experience with AWS/Azure at scale
Distributed microservice architectures with well architected domain boundaries
High volume async messaging architectures
Large scale relational and NoSQL style data stores

Title: Product Manager - Payments
RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
Who We Are:
Wayfair runs the largest custom e-commerce large parcel network in the United States, approximately 1.6 million square meters of logistics space. The nature of the network is inherently a highly variable ecosystem that requires flexible, reliable, and resilient systems to operate efficiently. 
Wayfair is seeking a senior product leader to shape and scale our global payments infrastructure and integrations. These platforms are critical for processing Wayfairs billions of dollars in annual global revenue and helping Wayfairs millions of customers shop confidently by making transactions with Wayfair secure, seamless, and convenient. 
You will partner with Wayfairs Financing, Loyalty, Payments, Fraud, and Gift Card business teams to drive product strategy, roadmaps, and delivery across a broad set of payment journeys. The Purchase technology teams also design, build, and evolve surrounding customer experiences including Cart, Checkout, Financing education & approval, Loyalty sign-up and renewals, across all web and native app platforms.
Wayfair believes everyone deserves a home they love, and that furnishing your home should be a source of fun, not anxiety. Our product team plays a crucial role in making this vision a reality for millions of people around the world. Partnering with engineering,design, analytics, and business partners across Wayfair, our product team ensures that were building technology that solves important customer problems in elegant, scalable, measurable ways.
Our customer technology team is responsible for building and growing the native apps and websites customers use to shop our catalog. We leverage technology to make shopping for millions of products feel simple and personal. 
We are looking for an experienced product manager to own product strategy, vision, and execution of the customer tech data engineering workstream. This team is responsible for the development and optimization of our enterprise-scale data infrastructure that fuels personalization, customer insights, and business performance across Wayfair. Youll lead a cross-functional team partnering closely with engineering, data science, and business stakeholders to build and evolve our core data pipelines, platforms, and tools to enable opportunities and insights across our e-commerce experience. Youll be part of an exceptionally talented Product Management and Technology community at a Fortune 500 company.
What Youll Do

Own Payments Capabilities: Drive product strategy and execution for key payments platform features such as authorization flows, routing, and settlement services.
Support Vendor Integrations: Partner with global payment processors, fraud vendors, and other FinTech providers to deliver reliable, cost-effective integrations that enhance customer trust.
Collaborate Across Teams: Work with stakeholders in Payments, Financing, Loyalty, Fraud, Cart/Checkout, and Finance to align business objectives with platform priorities.
Enable Scalable Infrastructure: Partner with Engineering to design APIs and services that can handle high throughput and global scale, while ensuring resilience and extensibility.
Measure & Optimize: Define and track KPIs like authorization rates, decline reasons, and payment costs. Use data to drive continuous improvements in conversion and efficiency.
Ensure Compliance & Security: Collaborate with Legal, Risk, and Security teams to ensure that payments systems meet regulatory and compliance requirements globally.
Champion Reliability: Contribute to building systems with strong observability, redundancy, and failover strategies to minimize customer disruption.

What Youll Need

Overall 6+ years of experience and 24 years of product management experience, ideally in payments, FinTech, or related e-commerce platform technology.
Understanding of core payments concepts such as authorization, routing, tokenization, chargebacks, and settlement.
Comfort engaging with engineering teams on architecture, APIs, and system design trade-offs  no coding required, but technical fluency is expected.
Strong product instincts and a platform-oriented mindset  youre motivated to build foundational capabilities that unlock downstream value.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, with experience aligning business and technical teams.
Analytical skills to interpret payments data, identify trends, and prioritize improvements.
Experience with third-party vendor integrations in payments or fraud is a plus.
Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or a related field  or equivalent practical experience.

Title: Data Scientist II, Customer Technology
RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements. 
Wayfair Data Science is the engine that powers an enterprise obsessed with data. The Wayfair websites generate over 100M clicks from the millions of customers that visit our sites every day to discover and purchase home goods. The Customer Tech Data Science team is focused on understanding and optimizing customer behavior on the website and mobile application as a key enabler for the company to move fast and iterate quickly on big business problems.
At their core, the Customer Tech Data Science team at Wayfair are strong in quantitative analysis, enjoy coding but also want to balance that with their interest in business and applying advanced modeling techniques. They think critically to tackle complex challenges, thrive in a fast-paced environment and are seeking a high-growth opportunity where they will have an immediate impact on day one. There are significant opportunities for new team members to emerge as leaders, taking on additional projects and responsibilities with strong performance.
What Youll Do:
As a Data Scientist, youll play a critical role in uncovering insights that shape strategic decisions and improve business performance. You will explore data trends, diagnose gaps, and identify growth & innovation opportunities across Wayfairs data. Your work will directly impact how the company understands performance and makes data-informed decisions.

Conduct in-depth analysis across large-scale datasets (clickstream, sales, product, logistics, and customer data) to uncover trends, gaps, and business opportunities.
Champion the use of emerging technologies - including GenAI and LLMs - to transform how we explore data and uncover insights, unlocking new ways to accelerate analysis, automate complex workflows, and make insights more accessible and actionable across the business.
Become a subject matter expert on key business metrics and customer behavior, ensuring accurate interpretation and analysis.
Drive innovation in business analysis by adopting and implementing new methodologies (e.g., key driver analysis, anomaly detection, forecasting, cohorting).
Establish robust KPI tracking and anomaly detection systems to ensure early identification of emerging issues and opportunities.
Collaborate with cross-functional partnersincluding Business Strategy, Product, and Engineeringto uncover actionable insights that drive growth and improve customer experience.
Design, run, and interpret A/B tests to make high-impact changes to the customer experience.
Build, automate, and maintain scalable dashboards and reports using tools like Looker, BigQuery (GBQ), SQL and Python to enable efficient and self-serve data access for stakeholders.
Develop optimized and maintainable code pipelines to transform multi-terabyte data into meaningful business insights and recommendations.

What You'll Need:

Bachelors in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, Information Systems, Economics, or other quantitative discipline; Masters preferred.
3 - 5 years of work experience in a relevant field, such as analytics or data science.
Proficient knowledge of a statistical programming language such as Python, R, SAS, or SPSS.
Proficient knowledge of SQL (incl. Aggregate functions, joins, etc.).
Experience conducting quantitative analyses on large and complex data sets.
Experience in leveraging modeling algorithms to derive business insights.
Experience with experimental test design such as A/B testing.
Experience with data visualization software (e.g. Google Data Studio, Tableau, PowerBI); experience with Looker a plus.
Analytical, creative, and innovative approach to solving problems.
Strong written and verbal communication.
Ecommerce or retail analytics experience is a plus.

Title: Upholstery Category Sales Specialist
RoleDescription:
ROLE: Upholstery Category Sales Specialist
Overview:We are seeking highly motivated sales professionals with a strong technical background to join our category sales team, specializing in the Upholstery market. In this role, you'll leverage your expertise to drive exceptional sales results through meaningful customer interactions. Your ability to understand and communicate complex product features will be key in helping customers make informed purchasing decisions and achieve your sales goals. If you love to connect with customers and help them find and purchase amazing products, then Wayfair may be the perfect place for the next steps in your career!Quick Highlights:

Full-Time Position
Compensation: $16/hour + Monthly Bonus potential
*Weekends Required*

Schedules are subject to change periodically
Note: This is a remote Sales specific role, and is NOT Customer Service based.
What Does a Category Sales Specialist Do?

Grow and Leverage Sales Expertise: Use your deep product knowledge and strong sales skills to help Wayfair customers navigate purchases within the applicable category. 
Meet a High Performance Bar: Meet or exceed your monthly revenue, calls per day targets, and/or other established KPIs in alignment with business expectations. 
Influence Sales: Utilize and expand your skills in selling products in a high growth and technical category through creative offerings and impactful initiatives.
Engage Customers: You will communicate with inbound customers as well as outbound follow ups for specialized category sales inquiries, working to create a positive customer experience from start to finish.
Adapt to Rapid Change: Engage in a high-energy, focused, and dynamic work environment where there can be quick pivots in our products, promotions, offerings, and operations.
Collaborate Effectively: Youll bring a willingness to share your innovative ideas and solutions to help make Wayfair a first in class customer experience.
Continuously Learn: Grow through Wayfairs world class training and continuous career development opportunities Youll be trained on our offerings, software, processes and supplier capabilities.
Act as a Brand Ambassador: Embody the Wayfair People Principles as a North Star in all your work to provide a first class customer experience. Exemplify a positive and professional attitude on a daily basis with customers and your team members.

 
What are the Requirements?

Sales Experience: 1 - 3 years of previous sales experience with demonstrated success in meeting or exceeding KPIs or performance metrics. (Previous technical category sales experience is highly preferred.)  
Category Knowledge: sales knowledge, strong business acumen, and ability to use your expertise to assist customers through their purchasing needs.

Title: Software Engineer III, Global Supplier Technology
RoleDescription:
Software Engineer III, Global Supplier Tech
Job Description
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
Who We Are:
Wayfair runs the largest custom e-commerce large parcel network in the United States, approximately 1.6 million square meters of logistics space. The nature of the network is inherently a highly variable ecosystem that requires flexible, reliable, and resilient systems to operate efficiently. 
We are looking for a passionate Backend Software Engineer to join the Fulfillment Optimization team. This team builds the platforms that determine how customer orders are fulfilled, optimizing for Wayfair profitability and customer delight. A big part of our work revolves around enhancing and scaling customer-facing platforms that provide fulfillment information on our websites, starting at the top of the customer funnel on the search pages all the way through orders being delivered. Throughout this customer journey, we are responsible for maintaining an accurate representation of our dynamic supply chain, determining how different products will fit into boxes, predicting how these boxes will flow through warehouses and trucks, and ultimately surfacing the information our customers need to inform their decision and the details our suppliers and carriers require to successfully execute on the promises made to our customers. We do all of this in milliseconds, thousands of times per second.
What Youll Do:

Partner with your business stakeholders to provide them with transparency, data, and resources to make informed decisions
Be a technical leader within and across the teams you work with.
Drive high impact architectural decisions and hands-on development, including inception, design, execution, and delivery following good design and coding practices.
Obsessively focus on production readiness for the team including testing, monitoring, deployment, documentation and proactive troubleshooting.
Identify risks and gaps in technical approaches and propose solutions to meet team and project goals.
Create proposals and action plans to garner support across the organization.
Influence and contribute to the teams strategy and roadmap.
Tenacity for learning - curious, and constantly pushing the boundary of what is possible.

We Are a Match Because You Have:

6+ years of experience in backend software engineering architecting and implementing robust, distributed web applications
Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent combination of education and experience
Track-record of technical leadership for teams following software development best practices (e.g. SOLID, TDD, GRASP, YAGNI, etc).
Track-record of being a hands-on developer efficiently building technically sound systems.
Experience building web services with Java , Spring Boot andMicroservices . 
Experience with Continuous Integration (CI/CD) practices and tools (Buildkite, Jenkins, etc.).
Experience architecting solutions leveraging distributed infrastructure (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes, etc).
Experience with Microsoft SQL Server, Aerospike, Redis.
Experience leveraging monitoring and logging technologies (e.g. DataDog, Elasticsearch, InfluxDB, etc).

Title: Associate - Supplier Inventory Management

Regularly communicate performance trends and improvement opportunities to management both within and outside your immediate line of reporting
